snippet: Tzipi Livni, who lost the leadership of her centrist Kadima Party and her position atop the opposition, resigned from the Israeli Parliament on Tuesday but said that she was not quitting public life.
abstract: Tzipi Livni resigns from Israel's Parliament, following her loss of leadership in the centrist Kadima Party and her position as leader of the opposition; announces that she is not quitting public life; move comes as Israeli politicians prepare for elections.
lead_paragraph: Tzipi Livni, who lost the leadership of her centrist Kadima Party and her position atop the opposition, resigned from the Israeli Parliament on Tuesday but said that she was not quitting public life.

headline.seo: After Leadership Defeat, Tzipi Livni Resigns From Israeli Parliament
headline.main: After Defeat, Livni Quits Parliament in Israel
headline.print_headline: After Defeat, Livni Quits Parliament In Israel
